body_html:
Thanks! It was my code based on the tutorial. I tried the mnist_with_summaries.py and it is working. In my code, I am using the suggested function :

def variable_summaries(var):
  """Attach a lot of summaries to a Tensor (for TensorBoard visualization)."""
  with tf.name_scope('summaries'):
    mean = tf.reduce_mean(var)
    tf.summary.scalar('mean', mean)
    with tf.name_scope('stddev'):
      stddev = tf.sqrt(tf.reduce_mean(tf.square(var - mean)))
    tf.summary.scalar('stddev', stddev)
    tf.summary.scalar('max', tf.reduce_max(var))
    tf.summary.scalar('min', tf.reduce_min(var))
    tf.summary.histogram('histogram', var)

And I am calling it after the definition of certain operations. Also I am using the new functions to merge and write

merged = tf.summary.merge_all()
train_writer = tf.summary.FileWriter('./logs/train',sess.graph)
init = tf.global_variables_initializer()

instead of the deprecated

merged = tf.summary.merge_all()
train_writer = tf.train.SummaryWriter('./logs/train',sess.graph)
tf.initialize_all_variables()

And finally recording the summaries. There's no error when I run my code.

summary, trnresult = sess.run([merged, accuracy], feed_dict={x: batch_xs,y: batch_ys,})
train_writer.add_summary(summary, step)

What else can I be missing?

def variable_summaries(var):
  """Attach a lot of summaries to a Tensor (for TensorBoard visualization)."""
  with tf.name_scope('summaries'):
    mean = tf.reduce_mean(var)
    tf.summary.scalar('mean', mean)
    with tf.name_scope('stddev'):
      stddev = tf.sqrt(tf.reduce_mean(tf.square(var - mean)))
    tf.summary.scalar('stddev', stddev)
    tf.summary.scalar('max', tf.reduce_max(var))
    tf.summary.scalar('min', tf.reduce_min(var))
    tf.summary.histogram('histogram', var)

And I am calling it after the definition of certain operations. Also I am using the new functions to merge and write
merged = tf.summary.merge_all()
train_writer = tf.summary.FileWriter('./logs/train',sess.graph)
init = tf.global_variables_initializer()

instead of the deprecated
merged = tf.summary.merge_all()
train_writer = tf.train.SummaryWriter('./logs/train',sess.graph)
tf.initialize_all_variables()

And finally recording the summaries. There's no error when I run my code.
summary, trnresult = sess.run([merged, accuracy], feed_dict={x: batch_xs,y: batch_ys,})
train_writer.add_summary(summary, step)

What else can I be missing?
body:
Thanks! It was my code based on the [tutorial](https://www.tensorflow.org/how_tos/summaries_and_tensorboard/). I tried the mnist_with_summaries.py and it is working.  In my code, I am using the suggested function :

```
def variable_summaries(var):
  """Attach a lot of summaries to a Tensor (for TensorBoard visualization)."""
  with tf.name_scope('summaries'):
    mean = tf.reduce_mean(var)
    tf.summary.scalar('mean', mean)
    with tf.name_scope('stddev'):
      stddev = tf.sqrt(tf.reduce_mean(tf.square(var - mean)))
    tf.summary.scalar('stddev', stddev)
    tf.summary.scalar('max', tf.reduce_max(var))
    tf.summary.scalar('min', tf.reduce_min(var))
    tf.summary.histogram('histogram', var)
```
And I am calling it after the definition of certain operations. Also I am using the new functions to merge and write
```
merged = tf.summary.merge_all()
train_writer = tf.summary.FileWriter('./logs/train',sess.graph)
init = tf.global_variables_initializer()
```
instead of the deprecated
```
merged = tf.summary.merge_all()
train_writer = tf.train.SummaryWriter('./logs/train',sess.graph)
tf.initialize_all_variables()
```
And finally recording the summaries. There's no error when I run my code.
```
summary, trnresult = sess.run([merged, accuracy], feed_dict={x: batch_xs,y: batch_ys,})
train_writer.add_summary(summary, step)
```

What else can I be missing?
